title: How to Create a ChatGPT Account: Guide + Troubleshooting

steps.title: Go to https://chatgpt.com/auth/login in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://chatgpt.com/auth/login in a web browser. You can use a desktop or mobile browser. If you aren't logged into an existing account, you'll see Log in or Sign up . You must have an email address to sign up for an account.

steps.title: Click Sign up.
steps.content: Click Sign up . This is the right button.

steps.title: Enter your email address and click Continue.
steps.content: Enter your email address and click Continue . You can also sign up using your Google , Microsoft , or Apple account. To do so, click the corresponding button. If you register with a Google, Microsoft, or Apple account, skip to Step 6 once you're signed in.

steps.title: Create a password and click Continue.
steps.content: Create a password and click Continue . Your password must be at least 12 characters long. Be sure to create a secure password .

steps.title: Verify your email.
steps.content: Verify your email. OpenAI will send an email to your inbox that contains a verification number. Open the message from OpenAI, then copy the number into the field to verify your email address. If you don't see it, check your spam or junk folder. If you didn't receive the email, click Resend email .

steps.title: Enter your full name and date of birth, and click Continue.
steps.content: Enter your full name and date of birth, and click Continue . You can use a nickname if desired.

steps.title: Log in to your ChatGPT account.
steps.content: Log in to your ChatGPT account. You can sign in to ChatGPT by pointing your web browser to https://chatgpt.com/auth/login . If you don't have a ChatGPT account, you can create a free one using the method above. ChatGPT Plus is a paid subscription that gives you higher limits on GPT-4o, o4-mini, image generation and advanced voice modes, access to GPT-4.5 (preview), o3, o4-mini-high, creating custom GPTs, and Sora video generation. It costs $20 per month. [1] X Research source ChatGPT Pro is a higher-end paid subscription that gives you unlimited access to GPT-4o, o3, o4-mini and o4-mini-high, and advanced voice, access to o1 pro and Operator (preview), and extended limits on Sora video generation and deep research. It costs $200 per month. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Upgrade plan on the menu.
steps.content: Click Upgrade plan on the menu. When logged in to ChatGPT, you'll see this option at the bottom-left corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Get Plus or Get Pro on the pop-up menu.
steps.content: Click Get Plus or Get Pro on the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Fill in all payment information and click Subscribe.
steps.content: Fill in all payment information and click Subscribe . Once you're signed up, you can start using the premium features of ChatGPT .

steps.title: If your email is unsupported, it might be network or browser-related.
steps.content: If your email is unsupported, it might be network or browser-related. If you see "The email you provided is not supported," there might be an easy fix. Many people have seen this error when trying to sign up with a Google or Microsoft account, though it may also affect other email addresses. Disconnect from your VPN when creating your ChatGPT account. If you're using a phone or tablet on Wi-Fi, switch to your mobile data. If you are using mobile data, switch to Wi-Fi. Clear your cache and cookies . Try signing up again in a new Incognito or Private window. Use a different web browser or device. If none of these tricks work, create a new email address specifically to sign up for ChatGPT. [2] X Research source

steps.title: If ChatGPT thinks you already have an account, try logging in.
steps.content: If ChatGPT thinks you already have an account, try logging in. Sometimes you'll see "There is already a user with email" or "Wrong authentication method" when signing up. This can happen if you've already tried to create an account but didn't finish the sign-up process, or you signed up using a different authentication method (e.g., your Google account instead of entering your Gmail address). In a new incognito window, try signing in using Continue with Google (gmail.com addresses), Continue with Microsoft (outlook.com, hotmail.com, or live.com addresses), or Continue with Apple (icloud.com, me.com, or mac.com addresses). If that doesn't work, use your email address to sign in. On the "Enter your password" screen, click Forgot password? and follow the on-screen instructions to reset your password.
